26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_LIST_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_LIST_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include "configuration.h"
31 #include "memory/MemoryAllocator.h"
32 #include <cassert>
33 #include <cstring>
34 #include <iterator>
35 #include <memory>
36 
37 namespace reactphysics3d {
38 
39 // Class List
43 template<typename T>
44 class List {
45 
46  private:
47 
48  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
49 
51  void* mBuffer;
52 
54  size_t mSize;
55 
57  size_t mCapacity;
58 
60  MemoryAllocator& mAllocator;
61 
62  public:
63 
65 
68  class Iterator {
69 
70  private:
71 
72  size_t mCurrentIndex;
73  T* mBuffer;
74  size_t mSize;
75 
76  public:
77 
78  // Iterator traits
79  using value_type = T;
80  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
81  using pointer = T*;
82  using reference = T&;
83  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
84 
86  Iterator() = default;
87 
89  Iterator(void* buffer, size_t index, size_t size)
90  :mCurrentIndex(index), mBuffer(static_cast<T*>(buffer)), mSize(size) {
91 
92  }
93 
95  Iterator(const Iterator& it)
96  :mCurrentIndex(it.mCurrentIndex), mBuffer(it.mBuffer), mSize(it.mSize) {
97 
98  }
99 
101  reference operator*() const {
102  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex < mSize);
103  return mBuffer[mCurrentIndex];
104  }
105 
107  pointer operator->() const {
108  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex < mSize);
109  return &(mBuffer[mCurrentIndex]);
110  }
111 
113  Iterator& operator++() {
114  assert(mCurrentIndex < mSize);
115  mCurrentIndex++;
116  return *this;
117  }
118 
120  Iterator operator++(int number) {
121  assert(mCurrentIndex < mSize);
122  Iterator tmp = *this;
123  mCurrentIndex++;
124  return tmp;
125  }
126 
128  Iterator& operator--() {
129  assert(mCurrentIndex > 0);
130  mCurrentIndex--;
131  return *this;
132  }
133 
135  Iterator operator--(int number) {
136  assert(mCurrentIndex > 0);
137  Iterator tmp = *this;
138  mCurrentIndex--;
139  return tmp;
140  }
141 
143  bool operator==(const Iterator& iterator) const {
144  assert(mCurrentIndex >= 0 && mCurrentIndex <= mSize);
145 
146  // If both iterators points to the end of the list
147  if (mCurrentIndex == mSize && iterator.mCurrentIndex == iterator.mSize) {
148  return true;
149  }
150 
151  return &(mBuffer[mCurrentIndex]) == &(iterator.mBuffer[iterator.mCurrentIndex]);
152  }
153 
155  bool operator!=(const Iterator& iterator) const {
156  return !(*this == iterator);
157  }
158 
160  friend class List;
161 
162  };
163 
164  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
165 
167  List(MemoryAllocator& allocator, size_t capacity = 0)
168  : mBuffer(nullptr), mSize(0), mCapacity(0), mAllocator(allocator) {
169 
170  if (capacity > 0) {
171 
172  // Allocate memory
173  reserve(capacity);
174  }
175  }
176 
178  List(const List<T>& list) : mBuffer(nullptr), mSize(0), mCapacity(0), mAllocator(list.mAllocator) {
179 
180  // All all the elements of the list to the current one
181  addRange(list);
182  }
183 
185  ~List() {
186 
187  // If elements have been allocated
188  if (mCapacity > 0) {
189 
190  // Clear the list
191  clear();
192 
193  // Release the memory allocated on the heap
194  mAllocator.release(mBuffer, mCapacity * sizeof(T));
195  }
196  }
197 
199  void reserve(size_t capacity) {
200 
201  if (capacity <= mCapacity) return;
202 
203  // Allocate memory for the new array
204  void* newMemory = mAllocator.allocate(capacity * sizeof(T));
205 
206  if (mBuffer != nullptr) {
207 
208  if (mSize > 0) {
209 
210  // Copy the elements to the new allocated memory location
211  T* destination = static_cast<T*>(newMemory);
212  T* items = static_cast<T*>(mBuffer);
213  std::uninitialized_copy(items, items + mSize, destination);
214 
215  // Destruct the previous items
216  for (size_t i=0; i<mSize; i++) {
217  items[i].~T();
218  }
219  }
220 
221  // Release the previously allocated memory
222  mAllocator.release(mBuffer, mCapacity * sizeof(T));
223  }
224 
225  mBuffer = newMemory;
226  assert(mBuffer != nullptr);
227 
228  mCapacity = capacity;
229  }
230 
232  void add(const T& element) {
233 
234  // If we need to allocate more memory
235  if (mSize == mCapacity) {
236  reserve(mCapacity == 0 ? 1 : mCapacity * 2);
237  }
238 
239  // Use the copy-constructor to construct the element
240  new (static_cast<char*>(mBuffer) + mSize * sizeof(T)) T(element);
241 
242  mSize++;
243  }
244 
248  Iterator find(const T& element) {
249 
250  for (uint i=0; i<mSize; i++) {
251  if (element == static_cast<T*>(mBuffer)[i]) {
252  return Iterator(mBuffer, i, mSize);
253  }
254  }
255 
256  return end();
257  }
258 
260  Iterator remove(const T& element) {
261  return remove(find(element));
262  }
263 
266  Iterator remove(const Iterator& it) {
267  assert(it.mBuffer == mBuffer);
268  return removeAt(it.mCurrentIndex);
269  }
270 
273  Iterator removeAt(uint index) {
274 
275  assert(index >= 0 && index < mSize);
276 
277  // Call the destructor
278  (static_cast<T*>(mBuffer)[index]).~T();
279 
280  mSize--;
281 
282  if (index != mSize) {
283 
284  // Move the elements to fill in the empty slot
285  char* dest = static_cast<char*>(mBuffer) + index * sizeof(T);
286  char* src = dest + sizeof(T);
287  std::memmove(static_cast<void*>(dest), static_cast<void*>(src), (mSize - index) * sizeof(T));
288  }
289 
290  // Return an iterator pointing to the element after the removed one
291  return Iterator(mBuffer, index, mSize);
292  }
293 
295  void addRange(const List<T>& list) {
296 
297  // If we need to allocate more memory
298  if (mSize + list.size() > mCapacity) {
299 
300  // Allocate memory
301  reserve(mSize + list.size());
302  }
303 
304  // Add the elements of the list to the current one
305  for(uint i=0; i<list.size(); i++) {
306 
307  new (static_cast<char*>(mBuffer) + mSize * sizeof(T)) T(list[i]);
308  mSize++;
309  }
310  }
311 
313  void clear() {
314 
315  // Call the destructor of each element
316  for (uint i=0; i < mSize; i++) {
317  (static_cast<T*>(mBuffer)[i]).~T();
318  }
319 
320  mSize = 0;
321  }
322 
324  size_t size() const {
325  return mSize;
326  }
327 
329  size_t capacity() const {
330  return mCapacity;
331  }
332 
334  T& operator[](const uint index) {
335  assert(index >= 0 && index < mSize);
336  return (static_cast<T*>(mBuffer)[index]);
337  }
338 
340  const T& operator[](const uint index) const {
341  assert(index >= 0 && index < mSize);
342  return (static_cast<T*>(mBuffer)[index]);
343  }
344 
346  bool operator==(const List<T>& list) const {
347 
348  if (mSize != list.mSize) return false;
349 
350  T* items = static_cast<T*>(mBuffer);
351  for (size_t i=0; i < mSize; i++) {
352  if (items[i] != list[i]) {
353  return false;
354  }
355  }
356 
357  return true;
358  }
359 
361  bool operator!=(const List<T>& list) const {
362 
363  return !((*this) == list);
364  }
365 
367  List<T>& operator=(const List<T>& list) {
368 
369  if (this != &list) {
370 
371  // Clear all the elements
372  clear();
373 
374  // Add all the elements of the list to the current one
375  addRange(list);
376  }
377 
378  return *this;
379  }
380 
382  Iterator begin() const {
383  return Iterator(mBuffer, 0, mSize);
384  }
385 
387  Iterator end() const {
388  return Iterator(mBuffer, mSize, mSize);
389  }
390 };
391 
392 }
393 
394 #endif
